intro: Elaeosticta knorringiana, commonly known as the Knorring's spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are cup-shaped structures characteristic of the family. The leaves are usually alternate and simple, with a rough texture and a tendency to exude a milky latex when damaged.
